column4: sorry to be off topic but this is VERY important for me and someone at my class, is it possible to boot from an external Western Digital HD on a HP Omnibook 500?
I already know he does have that option
but...
I tried to boot from a flash memory card, it detected it but couldnt boot from it
no his computer doesnt run linux at all
it runs Windows 2000 Pro
but I accidently deleted his boot partition...
no it was a seperate partition in his HD that had Windows 98 that came preinstalled on the comp, but it wasnt labeled or anything so I figured it was wasting space
he doesnt have a CD rom drive though
whats that gonna do if the boot partiton isnt on the comp and it doesnt have a CD rom drive?
did  you see the flash stick in the BIOS?
like could you select it in the boot order?
hrm... i'm guessing there's no usb floppy or cd rom drives sittin around?
you can boot a floppy?
what do you mean...
no get a win98 boot disk
doubt it
what was wrong with the boot disk?  did you setup the disk correctly?
you should be able to fix the mbr with that...
he's got a good point, move the hdd to your external enclosure & get the data off of it
since i guess you're not willing to use the win98 boot disk properly
if you have an external enclosure for a hdd and an internal cdrom drive that should work
an internal cdrom drive at all
